title: Awesome Game! || Grandelius vs Naiditsch || FIDE World Team Championship (2019)
description:
Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Nils Grandelius vs Arkadij Naiditsch
FIDE World Team Championship (2019), rd 4, Mar-8
Ruy Lopez: Berlin Defense (C65)

1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d3 d6 5. O-O Be7 6. Re1 O-O 7. c3 a6 8. Ba4 Re8 9. h3 Bf8 10. c4 Bd7 11. Be3 Nb8 12. Nc3 Bxa4 13. Qxa4 Nbd7 14. a3 Nc5 15. Qc2 c6 16. Rad1 Qc7 17. b4 Ne6 18. d4 exd4 19. Nxd4 Nd7 20. Nce2 Nxd4 21. Bxd4 b5 22. Ng3 c5 23. bxc5 dxc5 24. Ba1 Nb6 25. cxb5 axb5 26. Nf5 Nc4 27. Rd3 Rxa3 28. Rxa3 Nxa3 29. Qb2 c4 30. Nxg7 Rc8 31. Nf5 c3 32. Qc1 Kh8 33. Qg5 Qe5 34. Re3 b4 35. Rg3 Bc5 36. Nh6 Bxf2+ 37. Kxf2 Qd4+ 38. Kf3 Qd1+ 39. Kf4 Qd2+ 40. Kf3 Qd1+ 41. Kf2 Qd4+ 42. Qe3 Qxe3+ 43. Kxe3 Rf8 44. Kd4 f6 45. Kd5

To those of you who read the description: You are an excellent subscriber! :)

The FIDE World Team Championship is a biennial 10-team round-robin tournament that in 2019 is taking place from 5-14 March in Astana, Kazakhstan. Matches take place on four boards, with 2 match points for a win and 1 for a draw. Sweden replaced Poland, who declined their invitation.

Players receive 90 minutes for 40 moves, followed by 30 minutes to the end of the game, with a 30-second increment starting from move one. No draw offers are allowed until after move 30. Official website: wteams.astana2019.fide.com
